title: Unstuck and On Target: High School Intervention
description: Prepared intervention materials including lesson plans, interventionist manuals, student workbooks, parent handouts, and group activity materials.
Lead weekly group supervision meetings, prepared videos to review, documented student progress, and supported problem-solving methods to help with successful implementation of the intervention.
Led group activities and worked one-on-one with students to help promote flexible problem-solving and planning for autistic teens (ages 14-19).

Coordinated therapy team for teens who expressed suicidal ideation. Facilitated communication between school psychologist, counselors, community mental health providers, clinicians, and families to monitor mental health of the teens.

title: Life Skills Program Leader and Spanish Interpreter
description: Developed and lead group activities to promote a positive transition to adulthood for Latine, Black, and LGBTQ youth (ages 16-25) experiencing homelessness, immigration challenges, and unsafe/abusive households.

Independently prepared lessons and provided Spanish interpretation on several topics including self-care, time management, drug and alcohol education, healthy relationships, budgeting and financial management, job search, and interview preparation.
